security: Releasing the identity of Alfonso Dabdildox Torres or the details of his FRQ Part I could compromise intelligence sources and methods, potentially endangering the individual and disrupting ongoing intelligence operations in Mexico. Disclosing that the Station assigned Subject a cryptozyn on 15 October 1963 exposes signal intelligence practices, threatening future communications.
summary: A dispatch from the Chief of Station in Mexico City to the Chief of the WI Division, requesting operational approval and a 201 number for Alfonso Dabdildox Torres (FRQ Part I), whose cryptozyn, assigned 15 October 1963 by the Station, follows under separate cover.
summary_one_paragraph: Sent by Willard C. Curtis, Chief of Station in Mexico City, this secret dispatch is addressed to the Chief of the WI Division. It requests provisional operational approval and a 201 file number for Alfonso Dabdildox Torres, the subject of FRQ Part I. The dispatch notes that the subject's cryptozyn, assigned by the Station on October 15, 1963, is being transmitted separately. Copies of the dispatch and attachment are distributed to WRD with handling/working notes and sensitive operational handling notes, as well as to the station files.
title: FRQ Part I - Alfonso Dabdildox Torres
